etymology.value: From Middle English *winten*, from Old English *windan* (“to wind, turn, twist, move, go, proceed”), from Proto-Germanic *windaną (“to wind”), from Proto-Indo-European *wendʰ- (“to turn, wind, weave”).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Wint' is an archaic verb, meaning to cease or stop. It is rarely used in modern English.

readability_explanation.text: This is an archaic word and is not commonly used or understood in modern English.
